GROUP__sw_arch.content:
.. list2need::
   :types: sn_association

   *  (TYPE__sw_arch__satisfies__assumed_req) satisfies.
      The :need:`GROUP__sw_arch` satisfies :need:`TYPE__assumed_req`.
      ((targets="TYPE__assumed_req", link="LINK__satisfies"))
   *  (TYPE__sw_arch__covered_by__unit) covered by.
      The :need:`GROUP__sw_arch` is covered by :need:`TYPE__unit`.
      ((targets="TYPE__unit", link="LINK__covered_by"))
GROUP__sw_arch.title: Software Architecture

LINK__covered_by.content: A "covered_by" link indicates that a element is covered by another element.
LINK__covered_by.title: covered_by

LINK__covers.content: A "covers" link indicates that a element covers another element.
LINK__covers.title: covers

LINK__satisfies.content: A "satisfies" link indicates that a element satisfies another element.
LINK__satisfies.title: satisfies

LINK__verifies.content: A "verifies" link indicates that a test specification verifies a requirement.
LINK__verifies.title: verifies

OPTION__safety.content: The safety option indicates the safety level of a need.
OPTION__safety.name: safety
OPTION__safety.title: safety

TYPE__aou.content:
.. list2need::
   :types: sn_association

   *  (TYPE__aou__satisfies__assumed_req) satisfies.
      The :need:`TYPE__aou` satisfies :need:`TYPE__assumed_req`.
      ((targets="TYPE__assumed_req", link="LINK__satisfies"))
   *  (TYPE__aou__satisfies__sw_arch) satisfies.
      The :need:`TYPE__aou` satisfies :need:`GROUP__sw_arch`.
      ((targets="GROUP__sw_arch", link="LINK__satisfies"))
TYPE__aou.title: Assumption of Use

TYPE__test_specification.content:
A test specification describes a need that defines tests for requirements.

.. list2need::
   :types: sn_association

   *  (TYPE__test_specification__verifies) verifies.
      The test_specification verifies requirements.
      ((targets="GROUP__requirements", link="LINK__verifies"))
TYPE__test_specification.title: test_specification

arch.description: Mapping of uml key to uml content.

constraints.description: List of constraint names, which are defined for this need.

constraints_error.description: An error message set if any constraint failed, and `error_message` field is set in config.

constraints_passed.description: True if all constraints passed, False if any failed, None if not yet checked.

constraints_results.description: Mapping of constraint name, to check name, to result, None if not yet checked.

content.description: The main content of the need.

docname.description: Name of the document where the need is defined (None if external).

doctype.description: The markup type of the content, denoted by the suffix of the source file, e.g. '.rst'.

external_css.description: CSS class name, added to the external reference.

external_url.description: URL of the need, if it is an external need.

has_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list.

has_forbidden_dead_links.description: True if any links reference need ids that are not found in the need list, and the link type does not allow dead links.

is_external.description: If true, no node is created and need is referencing external url.

is_import.description: If true, the need was derived from an import.

is_modified.description: Whether the need was modified by needextend.

jinja_content.description: Whether the content was pre-processed by jinja.

layout.description: Key of the layout, which is used to render the need.

lineno.description: Line number where the need is defined (None if external).

parts.description: Mapping of parts, a.k.a. sub-needs, IDs to data that overrides the need's data

post_template.description: The template key, if the post_content was created from a jinja template.

pre_template.description: The template key, if the pre_content was created from a jinja template.

signature.description: Derived from a docutils desc_name node.

style.description: Comma-separated list of CSS classes (all appended by `needs_style_`).

template.description: The template key, if the content was created from a jinja template.
